belongs_to_collection.name: The Urban Crisis and the New Militants

response.original_title: The Urban Crisis and the New Militants: Module 5 - Police Power and Freedom of Assembly: The Gregory March
response.overview: Police Power and Freedom of Assembly: The Gregory March, documents the protests on Thursday, August 29th at the 1968 Democratic National Convention. Comedian/activist Dick Gregory is arrested as he attempts to lead a march to break the police cordon around the Chicago Loop. This film is incorporated into the Film Group’s feature “American Revolution II.”
response.title: The Urban Crisis and the New Militants: Module 5 - Police Power and Freedom of Assembly: The Gregory March

titles.title: Police Power and Freedom of Assembly: The Gregory March
